Posted By: Ideatog (11/11/2010 7:33:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Mind-bogglingly poor design. I can't imagine why R&D thought this ability needed to be mana-activated, and why the card itself needed to cost so much. As other people have said, this enchantment should have cost one or two mana at most, and the ability should take place automatically during your upkeep (or, for "security detail" flavour, during your end step).  
  
A waste of a perfectly lovely concept.
posts.html:
Mind-bogglingly poor design. I can't imagine why R&D thought this ability needed to be mana-activated, and why the card itself needed to cost so much. As other people have said, this enchantment should have cost one or two mana at most, and the ability should take place automatically during your upkeep (or, for "security detail" flavour, during your end step).

A waste of a perfectly lovely concept.

Posted By: Wulfsten (7/3/2011 10:30:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of the worst (at least regarding white) token engines i've seen so far.  
Costs for tokens have decreased in the last couple of years notably. (Compare to [Throne of Empires](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Empires))  
I think players would have called a card like [Luminarch Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Luminarch Ascension) ridiculously broken if it would have been printed in Mercadian Masks (especially since this set contains a ton of damage prevention :P)

Posted By: Lyoncet (7/21/2011 1:31:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As of this posting, this is officially the worst-rated card on Gatherer (with 0.717 / 5 stars).  
  
I can see why it's rare, because then relatively few people are cursed with owning one, as it's a "I dare you to find a use for me" puzzle card, and only the people who want the mental thrill of breaking it will choose to seek it out on the secondary market. I can see why it's at 4 CMC, because at lower cost it could actually be used in the early game, leaving the card bad , but not *puzzle* bad.  
  
I just can't see why this is mana-activated AND limited to one use per turn. One or the other, sure. Mana-activated to prevent an arbitrarily large number of activations from going on the stack in a turn. Once per turn to limit it to one token per turn (say, so you can't get a token, chump block, and get another). Why? So you can't follow-up Wrath with a chump in the same turn before turn 6? Because with both of those being CMC 4, ANY mana cost for the activation limits it to turn 5 or later ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
